Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Type A cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed (fired reddish) below; exterior: double ivy leaf frieze above black-figure decoration consisting of Dionysos (upper body dressed in cloak, right arm holding horn and probably vine tendril remaining) to left; vines in field.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number 75 is written on a label glued to the interior surface of the sherd. The cup appears to have been over-fired.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 10-1, N 34)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 62, no. 21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1432) (phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2955 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
